intro: Sonchus runcinatus, commonly known as field lettuce or prickly lettuce, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It features a basal rosette of broad, lobed leaves with serrated edges, and it produces a distinctive, spiny, globe-shaped flower head. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and is characterized by its yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides, fields, and waste areas. Its leaves are edible and have been used in traditional cuisine and herbal medicine.
